Line 42: Line 42:
Martha Jones is a particularly astute medical student. On her way into work at a London hospital, she bumps into a strange man ([[Doctor (Doctor Who)|the Doctor]]) who pauses in front of her and removes his tie, saying, "Like so, see?". When she arrives at work, she again meets the Doctor, who is lying in bed as a patient under the name 'John Smith'. He is unaware of seeing Martha earlier in the morning.
Martha Jones is a particularly astute medical student. On her way into work at a London hospital, she bumps into a strange man ([[Doctor (Doctor Who)|the Doctor]]) who pauses in front of her and removes his tie, saying, "Like so, see?". When she arrives at work, she again meets the Doctor, who is lying in bed as a patient under the name 'John Smith'. He is unaware of seeing Martha earlier in the morning.
â
A brutal mercenary police force, the rhinoceros-like [[List of Doctor Who monsters and aliens#Judoon|Judoon]], who have no jurisdiction on Earth, transport the hospital to the Moon using a "H<sub>2</sub>O Scoop" in order to apprehend and execute [[List of Doctor Who villains#Florence Finnegan|Florence Finnegan]], a shapeshifting, bloodsucking [[List of Doctor Who monsters and aliens#Plasmavore|Plasmavore]] with the ability to appear as whatever species whose blood she consumes. Finnegan attempts to evade capture by sucking the blood of humans. Her first victim is Mr Stoker, the head doctor, and consequently she registers as a human when scanned by the Judoon. The Doctor performs a "genetic transfer" - kissing Martha to obtain human [[DNA]], (as pictured) - in order to register as human when the Judoon scan him. Tricked into thinking the Doctor is human, Finnegan sucks his blood causing him to collapse unconscious. Finnegan is apprehended by the Judoon after Martha persuades them to rescan her and she registers as non-human this time having the Doctor's blood in her system. The Judoon then execute Finnegan for the murder of the child princess of Padrivole Regency Nine.
+
A brutal mercenary police force, the rhinoceros-like [[List of Doctor Who monsters and aliens#Judoon|Judoon]], who have no jurisdiction on Earth, transport the hospital to the Moon using a "H<sub>2</sub>O Scoop" in order to apprehend and execute [[List of Doctor Who villains#Florence Finnegan|Florence Finnegan]], a shapeshifting, bloodsucking [[List of Doctor Who monsters and aliens#Plasmavore|Plasmavore]] with the ability to appear as whatever species whose blood she consumes. Finnegan attempts to evade capture by sucking the blood of humans. Her first victim is Mr Stoker, the head doctor, and consequently she registers as a human when scanned by the Judoon. The Doctor performs a "genetic transfer" - kissing Martha to obtain human [[DNA]] - in order to register as human when the Judoon scan him. Tricked into thinking the Doctor is human, Finnegan sucks his blood causing him to collapse unconscious. Finnegan is apprehended by the Judoon after Martha persuades them to rescan her and she registers as non-human this time having the Doctor's blood in her system. The Judoon then execute Finnegan for the murder of the child princess of Padrivole Regency Nine.
Before expiring, Finnegan modified an [[MRI]] scanner to make it destroy all intelligent life on the Moon and on the half of Earth facing the Moon. Martha uses CPR on the Doctor's two hearts and manages to revive him, and he turns off the scanner. Oxygen levels are low and the occupants of the hospital are near death, but as they depart the Judoon return the hospital safely to Earth.
Before expiring, Finnegan modified an [[MRI]] scanner to make it destroy all intelligent life on the Moon and on the half of Earth facing the Moon. Martha uses CPR on the Doctor's two hearts and manages to revive him, and he turns off the scanner. Oxygen levels are low and the occupants of the hospital are near death, but as they depart the Judoon return the hospital safely to Earth.
